name: rakishness
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
the quality of being confidently careless and informal: They wear tweed caps in various angles of rakishness.
immoral behaviour, often that of a man who has sex with a lot of women: The three women are wary of the rakishness of men. She made him want to reform his rakishness.
More examplesFewer examplesHe could never wear headgear with the rakishness of a baseball cap, especially one worn backward.Her unapologetic rakishness made her so easy to like.He brings a jovial rakishness to the character of Benjamin Franklin.He is open and expansive, with just a hint of rakishness.
